In the Name &c. In the name of God, the Compassionate, the Merciful!
God make thy morning good, Abu' God make your morning good, Abu
l-Qâsim, and perfect thy comforts. 'l-Qasim, and perfect your comforts.
Be so good, Abu 'l-Qasim, Be so good, o Abu 'l-Q'asim, -
God help you, as to send may God strengthen thee - as to send
to me at once the slave-girl,
send her in one day, if God send her in one day, please
God, on the riding camels wills, on the riding camels,
and take Abu Muḥammad and do not and take Abû Muḥammad (with thee) and do not
commit her to any other, commit her to any other (person);
and there will not be any other and there will not carry thee
in this week any other than means of conveyance to carry thee
but these camels. this mount.
And a prayer is like an echo.
And bid Abu Bakr hasten And tell to Abû Bakr he may hasten
with the purchase of the article, and hasten thou with the purchase of the needful and hasten thou
to the utmost of thy ability, God help thee. to the utmost of thy ability, may God strengthen thee.
And be so good, Abu 'l-Qasim, And be so good, o Abu 'l-Qâsim, as to
be with the slave-girl,
for I have a need of thee. for I need thee
Serious, serious. urgently, urgently!
A prayer is better
than an echo.
